message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of 3D human pose estimation from 2D body joints of a single image, which is a common topic in computer vision and machine learning. The proposed approach involves unsupervised learning, joint dictionary learning, and shape decomposition modeling, which are all relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of geometric priors and the estimation of distributed combination coefficients, which are related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and graphics (cs.GR). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach on several datasets, which involves metrics and performance analysis, and thus falls under multimedia (cs.MM).
